meanings.definition: The act of flying over a particular area or location.
meanings.sent1: The overflights of the birds above the park were a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent2: The military conducted regular overflights over the disputed territory.
meanings.sent3: During the picnic, the unexpected overflights of seagulls caused quite a commotion.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams took her on overflights through the clouds, soaring high above the world.
meanings.sent5: The overflights of the hot air balloons painted the sky with vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: The flight of an aircraft over a specific region without landing.
meanings.sent1: The overflights of the helicopters were part of a search and rescue mission.
meanings.sent2: The government restricted overflights over the national park to protect the wildlife.
meanings.sent3: The overflights of the drones provided valuable aerial footage for the documentary.
meanings.sent4: The overflights of the fighter jets created a deafening roar in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The overflights of the small planes offered tourists a unique perspective of the city below.

meanings.definition: The passage of a bird or other flying creature over a certain area.
meanings.sent1: The overflights of the geese signaled the changing of seasons.
meanings.sent2: The overflights of the seagulls often left behind a trail of feathers.
meanings.sent3: The overflights of the pigeons in the park amused the children playing below.
meanings.sent4: The overflights of the eagles inspired awe in those watching from below.
meanings.sent5: The overflights of the hummingbirds brought a touch of magic to the garden.
